list_definition.definition: to strike the palms of the hands together eg to show approval, to mark a rhythm, or to gain attention etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: When the singer appeared, the audience started to clap loudly
Clap your hands in time to the music.

list_definition.definition: to strike (someone) with the palm of the hand, often in a friendly way

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Frank clapped him on the back and congratulated him.

list_definition.mean_english: tống ai vào tù nhanh chóng
list_definition.definition: to put suddenly (into prison, chains etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: She heard a clap of thunder.
They gave the performer a clap
He gave me a clap on the back.

list_ex_of_english: Several of his distinguished colleagues seemed to think that the end had come and were about to clap politely.
Repeated clapping motion in which target is trapped between the palms.
Jarred awake by a sudden clap of thunder, she found herself pregnant, and soon after, bore a supernatural child.
